events.name: MMPI Certificate Program
events.description:
Content

1. The theoretical and conceptual content of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI);
▫️Purpose and process of developing MMPI; transmission of its psychometric properties

▫️Emphasizing the advantages and limitations of MMPI

Explanation of the standardization study in Turkey

▫️Why MMPI 2 is needed

2. Application of MMPI
▫️Points to be considered in the application of the test (who it is applied to, under what physical conditions it is applied, who it is not applied to)

▫️Points to be considered in the test interview and test process

▫️How observations are interpreted

3. Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI):
▫️Introduction to validity and clinical subscales

▫️Determination of dual elevation types

▫️Determination and interpretation of configurations

▫️Examination of psychotic and neurotic profiles

▫️Examples of invalid profiles

4. Interpretation of MMPI
▫️How the MMPI profile is created and what to pay attention to

▫️Computer calculation, how to use the computer program

▫️Creating a profile through an example answer key

▫️Considering validity subscales individually and as a whole through example profiles

▫️Interpreting rising and falling scales in clinical subscales

▫️Determining the client's level of adaptation

Interpreting dual and triple elevations

▫️Considering specific patterns in validity and clinical subscales

▫️Interpreting the profile as a whole by considering validity and clinical subscale findings together

5. Reporting the Profile
▫️Points to consider in reporting

▫️Integrating clinical observation with the MMPI profile

▫️Converting the findings determined in the profile into a written report

▫️Working on sample reports and providing sample reports
